content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I approve this contribution because it's fun and quite simple. Seems relevant to me as well. It has a place among clashes. 
Great Contribution, Approved!
i just did it and it was really fun

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I accept this contribution because it seems relevant to me, neither too hard nor too easy. It will surely appeal to people wishing to improve their understanding of coding in a fun way.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great Contribution, Approved!
Hmmmm if "shortest" is one of your game modes, I think you may consider removing the input for contribution_name? But that's just a minor thing, other than that it's a nice one!

If you want to make it more realistic, you might want to include an instant 'Bad Contribution, Rejected!' if there is a correction_offered by 5DN1L that is not amongst corrections_made :smirk:.

A more serious remark:
- Should the third one maybe be <=5 instead of <=15, to connect to how codingame wants us to check clashes?
- I was wondering whether it was <15 or <=15 while solving. Current wording of statement 'within' is somewhat ambiguous. Maybe rephrase as "when the average [[duration]] it takes to solve is less than or equal to CondinGame's ..."
- While solving, I was wondering whether I would encounter corrections_made>corrections_offered, and what I would have to do with it. I think it is not included; maybe include it in the constraints? (0<=corrections_made<=corrections_offered<=20 would do that I think)

Hi @Code-Parser : i agree with your Contribution ...
-> I'll upvote for you.

BUT : will the "POSITIVELY-VOTED CONTRIBUTIONS" discarded when "downvotes" == 0 ?

Nice. This is a quick and easy Clash. I like it. 
Maybe you could change the output to:
<<Line 1:>> One of the following: {{Great Contribution, Approved!}}, {{Good Contribution, Approved!}} or {{Bad Contribution, Rejected!}}.

Other than that easily understandable. :)

Goal
* Suggest to simplify the first paragraph by changing "of a string that contains" to "that contain", and adding "respectively" after "[[duration]]".

* Just curious: why must downvotes be greater than zero too for a contribution to be considered positively-voted?

* You haven't mentioned corrections_made and corrections_offered must be zero for a contribution to be considered well-checked although your code contains such a condition check.

* Just mentioning, 15 minutes is relevant to clash of code contributions only, and not relevant to other types of contributions.

* Hmmm, the contribution name isn't relevant to solving the clash, is it?

Constraints
* Please change "[[contribution_name]]" to "length of [[contribution_name]]".

* The middle four "0 <" should be changed to "0 <=", as the current sets of constraints are violated in some cases.

* In one case corrections_offered = 20 and it violates the 4th constraint.

Game modes
* Not sure if it is easy to guess the requirement in Reverse mode ðŸ¤”. I'll leave that for others to decide.

Cases
* Please change Validator 1 to cover the case where only one condition is satisfied, similar to Test 1.

* Currently both Test 2 and Validator 2 covers the case of a contribution satisfying conditions 1 and 3. Please add two more pairs of cases to cover the situations of satisfying conditions 1 and 2 and conditions 2 and 3.

* When you add the above cases, please make sure these is at least one test and one validator where upvotes is positive while downvotes is zero.

Thanks.
Whew! Very time-consuming review, thanks for taking the time. I will fix them when I can.

Based on the current statement, a contribution is considered positively-voted only if downvotes is greater than zero. So, even if a contribution gets 100 upvotes and 0 downvotes, it's still not considered positively-voted.

Thanks man!

All fixed.

Test 4 has 5 min duration, just for clarity.

Thanks a lot!
Happy Coding!

I see your point... but the input for contribution name is not actually important or used when solving this clash. It's just as a minor detail that the coder doesn't need to account for in the solution. Lines 2-6 of input are the important details to solve for.

I'd prefer to keep the contribution name there just to make it seem a little more realistic, but would be happy to change it if you think it would be better. (Please reply if so.) ðŸ™‚ðŸ‘

Thanks for your comment and "Happy Coding!".
Code-Parser
ðŸ˜Thanks!
Thanks
Great! Thanks
thanks a lot!
Actually I think both way can work, the coder can always remove that part of the code if they wish haha. I concur that adding the name do make the whole scenario more realistic!
True that!

Ah ok; with my first question I meant to check whether you wanted to shift for the third criteria from 0-15 to 0-5 minutes. A clash taking 13 minutes is not considered 'EASILY-SOLVABLE'. It is your clash, so your choice of course.
I see... I will consider how to implement this. Thanks for the clarification.

@Jp82, thanks for the upvote!

I understand your question and have tried to resolve this issue.

To both @Jp82 and @5DN1L, I have revised the statement. Only upvotes need to be greater than 0 for the first criteria to work.

Does this help?
If so, the sentence "For this criteria to work, upvotes must be greater than 0." can also be deleted ðŸ˜‰
Alright thanks @5DN1L, changes made.
@Jp82 would you mind checking my latest clash?

Fixed all issues.

* Just curious: why must downvotes be greater than zero too for a contribution to be considered positively-voted?

To answer your question, I'm saving coders time by making the number of downvotes a positive integer, greater than zero. 

*Hmmm, the contribution name isn't relevant to solving the clash, is it?

No, it's not relevant at all. I just thought that it would add an irrelevant detail to the Test-cases, which would allow me to add some text to the clash.
Because I added this variable, I was able to self-promote my clashes (please see Test 1, Test 2 and Validator 2) and mention you in this clash (please see Validator 3, which is soon to be public as Test 3ðŸ‘ˆðŸ¤«)

Cases
* Last validator: Please change [[duration]] to 15 so that there is one validator covering the edge case (similar to Test 2).

* As your statement implies that a contribution must have at least 1 downvote for it to be considered positively-voted, please change at least one test and one validator to cover the situation where downvotes = 0.

* As your statement implies that a contribution must have at least 1 corrections_made and 1 corrections_offered for it to be considered well-checked, please change at least one validator to cover the situation where corrections_made = 0 and corrections_offered = 0 (similar to Test 1 & Test 2).

Thanks.

Will address them and make changes when I can. (Also sorry about comment on other contribution.)

Thanks again,
Code-Parser

Made Changes. Fixed Issues. Eradicated Bugs. Solved Problems. Erased Errors.

Anything else?
Code-Parser
Ermâ€¦ I can't see any changes made in relation to the 3 points I last raised?
Oh... heh... ðŸ˜… I'm sorry. I seem to have made the comment ahead of fixing the problems. I will get to them and fix them real soon. Sorry again.ðŸ˜“
Any news?

I am still going to fix it, just got a bit distracted while trying to:

1. Make a new contribution
2. Rejecting some contributions
3. Coming back to respond and fix this clash.

Sorry, will get to it soon. I mean it this time.
No worries, just make sure you revise it before publishing it ðŸ˜‰

Right... re-read your comment and understood it this time.

I have made the changes as follows:

Validator 6 [[duration]] changed to 15 mins.

Test 4 and Validator 4 have been changed to have both corrections offered and corrections fixed at 0.
Test 4 and Validator 4 also have downvotes set to 0.

I have fixed the issues... although new ones might pop up.

Thanks.
Thanks for following up. No new issues that I can see for now, just the weird design choice raised by @Jp82, but it's not a deal-breaker for me.

I agree with his and yours.

I have tried to fix it.
OK, but now you have to revise Test 3 and Validator 3 again to cover the situation where ALL conditions (instead of just two of them) aren't fulfilled. Thanks.

Hey @5DN1L, I have fixed the Test 3 and Validator 3!

Anything else?

I promise this will be the last batch of changes (unless something unexpected happensâ€¦):

All the expected output should remain unchanged, but your solution code needs to be updated first regarding the "positively-voted" condition.

Test 5: change downvotes to 0.

Validator 5: change downvotes to 0.

Test 6: change upvotes to 15.

Validator 6: change upvotes to 19.

Thanks.
